title: Tables Settings
description: For each table that you want users be able to view or edit in the app, configure the relevant fields.

display_name.title: Display Label
display_name.description: Label used when displaying the table

item_name.title: Item Label
item_name.description: Label used when referring to an item in the table

description.title: Description
description.description: Descriptive text displayed when displaying the table

actions.title: Allowed Actions to be performed on the table
actions.description: Allowed actions to be performed on the table by default. Can be overriden by various plugin functions (see App Settings).

hide_from_menu.title: Suppress In Auto-Generated Menus
hide_from_menu.description: This list shall include all actions that identify the menu from which this table shall be hidden even if the action is allowed. Currently only menus for "new" and "list" actions are generated automatically, so these may be in the array

auto.title: Auto Value?
auto.description: Is the table automatically set by the database, e.g. by a sequence or auto-increment value? If this is the case, you need to specify the Sequence Name below

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: List all columns that are part of the primary key

sequence_name.title: Sequence Name
sequence_name.description: If primary key values in this table are auto-generated by a sequence in PostgreSQL, specify the sequence name here. Otherwise, this setting is ignored.

show_in_related.title: Show Shortcut in Related Tables
show_in_related.description: In the record view page, there is a dropdown linking to tables where the current record is linked through a foreign key field. Specify whether your want this table to appear in this dropdown list.

sort.title: Default Sorting
sort.description: Used for default sorting of the table in list mode. Provide an ordered array of columns with sort information

column_name.title: Column Name
column_name.description: Name of the column to sort

sort_dir.title: Order
sort_dir.description: Specify the order as ascending (asc) or descending (desc)

hooks.title: Insert/Update Hooks
hooks.description: Functions to call before/after certain events. For after_* hooks, the arguments are: (1) table name (2) table settings and (3) primary key/value array; for before_* hooks the arguments are (1) table name (2) table settings (3) column names array reference, (4) column values array reference

event.title: Event
event.description: Event for which a hook function exists

function.title: Function
function.description: Name of the function to invoke for the event.

additional_steps.title: Linkage Shortcuts
additional_steps.description: Linkage shortcuts offered to be performed after a new record was created or a record is being viewed to link this record with others via separate linkage tables

shortcut.title: Shortcut Details
shortcut.description: Display and linkage details of the shortcut

label.title: Label
label.description: Label to be displayed in the shortcuts dropdown menu

foreign_key.title: Foreign Key
foreign_key.description: Foreign key field in this database table

custom_actions.title: Custom Record Actions
custom_actions.description: Custom actions on records that are offered in particular viewing modes through particular icons, which will invoke a custom function. Parameters passed are: (1) name of the current table (2) table info object (3) the record retrieved from the database using PDO::FETCH_ASSOC and (4) this custom action object, which means that any additional key/value pairs you add to this array will get passed to the handler function. The expected return value of the handler function is a HTML string representing the icon to display for each record/row in the table.

mode.title: View Mode
mode.description: View mode to which this custom action shall apply. Currently only the mode list is supported

handler.title: Handler Function
handler.description: Handler function to call for the custom action

render_links.title: Render Links
render_links.description: If link and list actions are allowed in this table, then there will be an extra icon in the table in list view for each record that allows to view the actual object represented by the record (e.g. an image). Multiple such icons can be defined here.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: The name of a glyphicon that works with bootstrap, e.g. eye-open or trash. See the full list here

href_format.title: Link Format
href_format.description: A URL template that will be used in a sprintf() call, with the Field value (see below) as parameter. Therefore this string should contain one %s

field.title: Field
field.description: Name of the field whose value will be used to replace %s in the Link Format

title.title: Tooltip
title.description: Tooltip text shown when hovering the mouse cursor over the link icon

form_tabs.title: Tabulated Forms
form_tabs.description: If tabbed record editing and viewing form is desired, these settings need to be filled.

tabs.title: Tabs
tabs.description: Specify any number of tabs and their details

id.title: ID
id.description: Identifier of the tab, to be used in the 'tab' setting of the table's fields.

label.title: Label
label.description: Label to display on the tab

intro.title: Intro Text
intro.description: If specified, any information (HTML encoded) that should be displayed at the top of the form tab

restrict_modes.title: Restricted Views
restrict_modes.description: By default, the tabs are shown on new, edit, and view forms. You may restrict the forms here

validation_func.title: Form Validation Function
validation_func.description:
Allows naming a validation function that is invoked upon submission of the new and edit forms. This function needs to be implemented in JavaScript; the file in which it is implemented needs to be included via the add_javascript() helper function; the best place to do this in most circumstances is the Preprocessing Function defined in App Settings.
The function is called with three arguments:
  • table_name: string (the current table)
  • table_settings: object (a JS object representing the table's settings from settings.php)
  • values: object (for each column this object maps the column name to the value entered in the form)
Expected return values are: if there are validation errors in the form, the function must return a JSON object that maps each erroneous form field to an error message to be displayed next to the form field; if there are no errors in the form, the function must return null

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Define the settings for each relevant field in this table

field_name.title: Name
field_name.description: Name of the field in the database

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of the field. Determines the control used in editing form

len.title: Maximum Length
len.description: Maximal number of characters that the input control can hold. Relevant only for T_TextLine, T_TextArea, and T_Password. If this is set, it can be used in combination with the Display Remaining Character Count setting

display_remaining_chars.title: Display Remaining Character Count?
display_remaining_chars.description: If there is a character limit (see Maximum Length setting) and this setting is true, the remaining character count will be displayed once the user focuses on the control.

required.title: Required Field?
required.description: Whether or not a value is required for this field (i.e., there is a NOT NULL constraint)

editable.title: Editable Field?
editable.description: Whether or not this field should be offered in the new/edit forms. For an automatically generated primary key field or some computed field, this should be set to false. Even with then, the field will be displayed in list and view modes. If it is desired to completely hide this field from the user, the field itself should not be defined as a field at all.

width_columns.title: Width
width_columns.description: Specifies the number of columns in the bootstrap grid occupied by the input control. If this is not set, the width is calculated automatically for T_TextLine, otherwise the default is 7. Value must be between 1 and 9

height_rows.title: Textarea Rows
height_rows.description: Specifies the number of rows to be offered by the input control. Only applicable to T_TextArea fields

resizeable.title: Textarea Resizable?
resizeable.description: Controls whether the text area control is vertically resizeable. Only applicable to T_TextArea fields.

help.title: Help Text
help.description: Help text to display about this field in the new/edit forms when the user clicks on the help icon. Can contain HTML.

show_setnull.title: Show Set Null Checkbox?
show_setnull.description: Whether or not to show a checkbox allowing to explicitly set a NULL value for a non-required field (applies to input and textarea fields). Even if the checkbox is not shown, it is invisibly there and automatically checked/unchecked upon user input.

default.title: Default Value
default.description: Default value to set for the field's control when creating a new record. Occurrences of %SESSION_USER% in this string are replace with the current user's ID. For a T_Boolean field, this can be either 'on' (=true) or 'off' (=false)

options.title: Options
options.description: Currently this is only relevant for T_Boolean fields. The properties you define here are converted to a JSON object to initizalize the on/off toggle. All initialization options listed under http://www.bootstraptoggle.com/ can be provided. You should at least set the labels for 'on' and 'off' status of the toggle according to the purpose of this boolean field. If no options are provided here, the default labels for 'on' and 'off' states of the toggle are based on the localized strings boolean-field.default.yes and boolean-field.default.no, respectively.

values.title: Values
values.description:
Define values by adding properties to this setting.
  • For T_Enum type: An object with properties reflecting the actual DB value, and value representing the label to display to the user, e.g. '1': 'January', '2': 'February', ...
  • For a T_Boolean type: This can be used to map 'on' and 'off' to other values than true and false, respectively; if provided, this must be an object with properties 'on' and 'off', e.g. 'on': 'New Car', 'off': 'Used Car'. Note that the values are sent to the DB, so they need to match the type of the column in the DB (in the example the target field could be a text column). It is recommended to provide custom values only for non-boolean columns.

allow_create.title: Allow Creating Linked Records?
allow_create.description: If set to false, it suppresses the "Create New" button that is displayed next to lookup boxes. Note: this setting might conflict with the Lookup seetting Hide Dropdown

lookup.title: Lookup
lookup.description: Required for T_Lookup fields. Details of the foreign key relationship with another table to support filling of foreign key dropdown boxes

cardinality.title: Cardinality
cardinality.description: Whether this field is a foreign key in this very table (CARDINALTY_SINGLE), reflecting a 1:n relationship, or whether this relationship is actually represented in a separate table reflecting an m:n relationship (CARDINALITY_MULTIPLE). In the latter case, the Linkage settings must be provided

table.title: Table
table.description: Name of the table referenced by this foreign key field

field.title: Field
field.description: Field in the table referenced by this foreign key field (typically the primary key of the other table)

display.title: Display Expression
display.description: Since the foreign key is typically a numeric key, this setting can be used to define what to display to the user. Can be either a string literal representing a field name in the referenced table; or it can be an object specifying the columns used in an expression.

oneOf.title: Field Name
oneOf.description: Specify the name of the field in the lookup table to be displayed in the dropdown box

oneOf.title: Expression
oneOf.description: Provide columns and an expression to display to the user.

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: Specify the columns used in the Expression

expression.title: SQL Expression
expression.description: The SQL expression may refer to indexes in specified in the Columns by their index as %1, %2, etc.

sort.title: Sort By Display Expression
sort.description: In case of multiple lookup values, this setting determines whether the linked records are sorted using the Display Expression. Only relevant for CARDINALITY_MULTIPLE.

default.title: Default Value
default.description: Default option for this foreign key reference to pick from the dropdown when creating a new record. This type should be automatically convertible to text

related_label.title: Label in Referenced Records
related_label.description: Text to display in the "List Related" dropdown when viewing any record of the table referenced by this field (e.g. "Cars Sold By This Agent"). If missing, the label will be constructed automatically from the table's Display Name and the field's Label, (e.g. "Cars Sales (As Agent)")

async.title: Asnychronous Fetching of Matching Records
async.description: When provided, specifies how to dynamically fetch records into the dropdown box based on keyboard input. This is handy if the linked table holds many records

min_input_len.title: Minimum Input Length
min_input_len.description: Minimum number of characters the user has to type before matching records are fetched

delay.title: Delay
delay.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before sending an Ajax request after a user keystroke

max_results.title: Maximum Number of Results to Fetch
max_results.description: If set, the number of results fetched from the async query is limited to this number. If the query would return more results, a notice is displayed to the user to make them aware of this fact

min_threshold.title: Threshold
min_threshold.description: The dropdown box will behave like a normal (non-async) control if less then the defined threshold number of options are available. Otherwise, if there are more options, or if this setting is not defined at all, the box will be an async lookup box.

label_display_expr_only.title: Only Display Expression as Label?
label_display_expr_only.description: By default the label for lookup values is composed of the display expression and in parentheses the respective primary key name and value. If you wish to suppress the parentheses, and only use the Display Expression result, set this to true

hide_dropdown.title: Hide Dropdown Box?
hide_dropdown.description: In some cases it might be useful to allow only the creation of new associations using "Create New" button, and not by selecting existing records through the dropdown box. If this is set to true, the dropdown box will not be shown. If the field is CARDINALITY_SINGLE and disabled for some reason, the dropdown will be shown regardless of this setting. Note: this setting might conflict with the Allow Creating Linked Records setting of the field. If dropdown is to be hidden, the Allow Creating Linked Records must be enabled as well, otherwise nothing will be shown.

create_new_label.title: Button Label for Creating Linked Records
create_new_label.description: Label for the button next to the dropdown box, which allows users to add new records to the linked table

allow_edit.title: Allow Editing Linked Records?
allow_edit.description: Whether to allow the user to edit the associated record from the lookup table. Note that enabling this will only have an effect if the lookup table is configured as a table, and if edit is an allowed action there. If this setting is not provided, the default value will be taken from the Allow Editing Linked Records by Default in the App settings

predefined_values.title: Predefined Values
predefined_values.description:
Object mapping fieldnames to their predefined values, which will be used when the user creates a new record using the "Create New" button, e.g. 
"name": "Barles Chronson", // string value
"height": 1.78, // numeric value
"enemies": [3,77] // foreign keys for T_LOOKUP/CARDINALITY multiple field
"mother": { "field": "name" }

field_settings_override.title: Field Settings Override
field_settings_override.description:
Object mapping fieldnames to settings that override those in defined for the lookup table or the current context. This object will be used when the user creates a new record using the "Create New" button. Use this with caution, since it may contradict the constraints in the DB or the dbWebGen logic. Each value is either h (hide the control) or any contextually meaningful combination of
  • e ... enable the control
  • d ... disable the control
  • r ... make field required
  • o ... make field optional
  • s ... show the control if hidden

no_link.title: Suppress Hyperlinks?
no_link.description: Whether to suppress the rendering of a hyperlink to the linked records when viewing and listing records

linkage.title: Linkage
linkage.description: If cardinality was set to CARDINALITY_MULTIPLE, you need to define here the m:n relationship table that links records from this table (via Foreign Key (Self)) with records of the other table (via Foreign Key (Other))

fk_self.title: Foreign Key (Self)
fk_self.description: Name of the foreign key in the linkage <i>Table<i> which references the present table

fk_other.title: Foreign Key (Other)
fk_other.description: Name of the foreign key in the linkage <i>Table<i> which references the other table

defaults.title: Default Values
defaults.description: Object defining field defaults for non-key fields when creating a new linked record. For each field, occurrences of %SESSION_USER% in the default values will be replaced with the current user's ID

render_func.title: Rendering Function
render_func.description:
By default, multiple records are simple separated by a bullet character. By providing a custom function name here, you can change the default behavior for rendering the linkage to be applied when viewing a record. The function takes the following arguments:
  • &$field is the field settings array
  • $item_html is the HTML code for the linked item
  • $index is the item's index in the list
  • $total_num_items is the total number of items in the list
  • &$params is reserved for future use; currently the engine will pass a reference to an empty array
The function must return the HTML to be rendered for the current item

max_num.title: Limit
max_num.description: If a number greater than zero is provided here, the number of linked records will be limited to this number. When the limit is reached, the dropdown and the Create New button will be disabled. This setting is only considered if cardinality is CARDINALITY_MULTIPLE
